gw.plugin.policy.search

Interface IPolicySearchAdapter

  • All Superinterfaces:
    com.guidewire.pl.system.integration.plugins.internal.InternalPlugin, java.rmi.Remote

    public interface IPolicySearchAdapter
extends com.guidewire.pl.system.integration.plugins.internal.InternalPlugin
    IPolicySearchAdapter represents the interface to an external system that performs a search and retreival of policy data.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      PolicyRetrievalResultSet retrievePolicyFromPolicy(Policy policy)
      Retrieve a single, unique policy based on an existing Policy entity.
      PolicyRetrievalResultSet retrievePolicyFromPolicySummary(PolicySummary policySummary)
      Retrieve a single, unique policy based on a PolicySummary entity.
      PolicySummary retrievePolicySummaryFromPolicy(Policy policy)
      Retrieve the policy summary associated with the specified policy.
      PolicySearchResultSet searchPolicies(PolicySearchCriteria criteria)
      Search a policy store, returning policy summaries that match the supplied criteria.

    • Method Detail

      • retrievePolicyFromPolicySummary

        PolicyRetrievalResultSet retrievePolicyFromPolicySummary(PolicySummary policySummary)
                                                  throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Retrieve a single, unique policy based on a PolicySummary entity. Note: The TotalVehicles property for a policy should represent the actual number of vehicles extant on the policy. If it is not returned correctly, the UI may appear incorrect. If the TotalVehicles field cannot be returned correctly by the external system, the IgnorePolicyTotalVehicles config parameter should be set to indicate that the fields should be ignored. Similarly for TotalProperties. Note: When adding contacts to the policy, the associated ClaimContactRoleData object must have its Policy field set to the policy.
        Parameters:
        policySummary - a PolicySummary entity containing all of the information required to uniquely identify the Policy to be returned
        Returns:
        A non-null structure representing a single matching policy.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • retrievePolicyFromPolicy

        PolicyRetrievalResultSet retrievePolicyFromPolicy(Policy policy)
                                           throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Retrieve a single, unique policy based on an existing Policy entity. Note: The TotalVehicles property for a policy should represent the actual number of vehicles extant on the policy. If it is not returned correctly, the UI may appear incorrect. If the TotalVehicles field cannot be returned correctly by the external system, the IgnorePolicyTotalVehicles config parameter should be set to indicate that the fields should be ignored. Similarly for TotalProperties. Note: When adding contacts to the policy, the associated ClaimContactRoleData object must have its Policy field set to the policy.
        Parameters:
        policy - a Policy entity which already exists in ClaimCenter. The Policy returned should match this one in all respects, including incomplete population of extended parts of the entity (like arrays)
        Returns:
        A non-null structure representing a single matching policy.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • searchPolicies

        PolicySearchResultSet searchPolicies(PolicySearchCriteria criteria)
                              throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Search a policy store, returning policy summaries that match the supplied criteria. If the size of the results exceeds the maximum allowable results, then the only the first n policy summaries are returned.
        Parameters:
        criteria - Policy search criteria.
        Returns:
        A non-null structure representing the policy search results.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • retrievePolicySummaryFromPolicy

        PolicySummary retrievePolicySummaryFromPolicy(Policy policy)
                                       throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Retrieve the policy summary associated with the specified policy. CC uses this for policy refresh to support risk unit selection. Implementing classes can throw UnsupportedOperationException if desired.
        Parameters:
        policy - a Policy entity which already exists in ClaimCenter.
        Returns:
        A non-null structure representing a policy search results, which should be a single PolicySummary.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
